intro: Octomeria gracilicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
